meta.name: description
meta.content: The 501 Not Implemented HTTP status code indicates the server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request.

main.p: The 501 (Method Not Allowed) HTTP status code indicates the method is not supported by the resource. With this status code, the origin server MUST generate an Allow header containing a list of the target resource's currently supported methods.

The primary purpose of this is to indicate the server is unfamiliar with the requested method. This status code is emitted after the request headers have been parsed, before the request-URI is dereferenced. The response should include a document listing the supported methods, or link to documentation describing the supported methods.
If the server supports the requested method, but the resource does not, see 405 Method Not Allowed.
The Expect header can be used to indicate a client requires a specific feature from a server. Failure to meet this requirement will generate a seperate status code, 417 Expectation Failed.
The client can reissue the request modified to use a different method, if there is a way to do so.
The client can make a GET request for the resource, then a PUT request with the modified version.

dl.dd: The server does not support the functionality required to fill the request.

dd.a: RFC 7231: HTTP/1.1 Semantics and Content §6.6.2. 501 Not Implemented

main.pre:
HTTP/1.0 501 Not Implemented Content-Type: text/plain
The "MGET" method is not recognised by this server.
See <http://example.com/help> for information on our offerings.
